name: Pesinden Langit Antariksa "Upit Sarimanah"
description:
Upit Sarimanah is a very famous Sinden (a javanese singer who sing with the traditional gamelan orchestra). When she performed in 1950, the number of guests who came was inevitable. Because of that huge mass audience, the move was chaos and caused three people died, children lost their parents, wives lost their husbands, and many people lost their wallets. News spreads information that her popularity is the cause of the bloodiest massacre in modern history. 

This incident took place five years after Indonesia's independence and many people longed for entertainment, making wayang and sinden performances the most awaited event. At that time, Indonesian citizen were very poor, the economy was still very weak. The artist, in this case is "Sinden", is a figure missed by the people who have been tormented by colonialism for years. Sinden has a privileged position to stay on the same stage as the Dalang (the shadow puppet master). This profesion is the first female character that demonstrate gender equality in art. 

Upit Sarimanah was a proof that a female character and their skill not only light up the performance but also  brought the huge crowd.
